name: Whiterun
description: Whiterun is one of the nine major cities in Skyrim and the capital of Whiterun Hold. The city is located in the central tundra of Skyrim, along the White River that flows from Riverwood. It is the most centrally located of all the cities in Skyrim and serves as a major trading hub.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%238B7355%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3Eüè∞%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Blackreach
description: Blackreach is a massive underground cavern found beneath the ruins of several Dwemer cities. This vast, bioluminescent cave system is home to Falmer, Chaurus, and other dangerous creatures. The ancient Dwemer architecture stands as a testament to their advanced civilization.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23001a33%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22%2300ffff%22%3Eüåå%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Solitude
description: Solitude is the capital city of both Haafingar Hold and the province of Skyrim. Located on a natural arch over the Sea of Ghosts, it is the most prosperous city in Skyrim and the seat of the Imperial Legion's power in the province. The imposing Blue Palace overlooks the city.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%233366aa%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3Eüëë%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: High Hrothgar
description: High Hrothgar is a monastery situated at the top of the Seven Thousand Steps, a treacherous mountain path leading to the peak of the Throat of the World. It is home to the Greybeards, masters of the Way of the Voice who live in absolute silence and contemplation.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23cccccc%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22%23333333%22%3E‚õ∞Ô∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Riften
description: Riften is a major city in southeastern Skyrim near the borders of Morrowind and Cyrodiil. The city is built on the shores of Lake Honrich and is known for its fishing industry and criminal underworld. The Thieves Guild operates from the Ratway beneath the city.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23663300%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3Eüåä%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Winterhold
description: Once a great city rivaling Solitude in power and influence, Winterhold was largely destroyed during the Great Collapse. Now only a small village remains, overshadowed by the College of Winterhold, the premier institution for magical studies in Skyrim.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%2399ccff%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22%23003366%22%3EüîÆ%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Sovngarde
description: Sovngarde is the Nordic afterlife, a realm in Aetherius reserved for Nord warriors who die valiantly in battle. The Hall of Valor stands at its center, where ancient heroes feast and sing for eternity. The realm is shrouded in mist conjured by Alduin to trap souls.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23ffd700%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3E‚öîÔ∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Markarth
description: Markarth is a city carved into the living rock of a mountain in the Reach. The city is known for its rich silver mines and ancient Dwemer architecture. It is also the site of significant political intrigue involving the Forsworn rebellion and the Silver-Blood family.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23996633%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3E‚öíÔ∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Bleak Falls Barrow
description: Bleak Falls Barrow is an ancient Nordic tomb located in the mountains south of Riverwood. The ruin contains the first Word Wall the Dragonborn encounters and is home to dangerous Draugr, including a powerful Overlord. The Golden Claw puzzle guards its inner sanctum.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23555555%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3E‚ö∞Ô∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Sky Haven Temple
description: Sky Haven Temple is an ancient Blades sanctuary built into the Karth River canyon. Hidden behind a secret entrance activated by Dragonbane, this fortress served as a base for the Blades during the Akaviri invasions. The temple houses a massive relief depicting Alduin's Wall.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23cc9966%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3Eüó°Ô∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Dwemer Museum
description: Located in Understone Keep in Markarth, the Dwemer Museum houses the most extensive collection of Dwemer artifacts in Skyrim. Curated by Court Wizard Calcelmo, the museum contains relics from the lost Dwemer civilization, including automatons, armor, and mysterious devices.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23bb8844%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22white%22%3EüèõÔ∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E

name: Throat of the World
description: The Throat of the World is the highest peak in Skyrim and all of Tamriel. This sacred mountain is home to Paarthurnax, the leader of the Greybeards. At its summit stands a Word Wall and the Time-Wound where the ancient Nords banished Alduin through time.
imagePath: data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22%3E%3Crect fill=%22%23e6f2ff%22 width=%22300%22 height=%22200%22/%3E%3Ctext x=%2250%25%22 y=%2250%25%22 font-size=%2240%22 text-anchor=%22middle%22 dominant-baseline=%22middle%22 fill=%22%23003d7a%22%3EüèîÔ∏è%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E
